member.name: T:Cadru.IO.ExecutableType
member.summary: Specifies the executable file type.

member.name: F:Cadru.IO.ExecutableType.Unknown
member.summary: The file executable type is not able to be determined.

member.name: F:Cadru.IO.ExecutableType.DOS
member.summary: The file is an MS-DOS .exe, .com, or .bat file.

member.name: F:Cadru.IO.ExecutableType.Win32Console
member.summary: The file is a Microsoft Win32®-based console application.

member.name: F:Cadru.IO.ExecutableType.Windows
member.summary: The file is a Windows application.

member.name: T:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo
member.summary: Provides an encapsulated implementation of the standard .NET and the SHGetFileInfo API method.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, which acts as a wrapper for a file path.
member.param: The fully qualified name of the new file, or the relative file name.
member.exception: is a .
The caller does not have the required permission.
is empty, contains only white spaces, or contains invalid characters.
Access to fileName is denied.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
contains a colon (:) in the middle of the string.
member.remarks: You can specify either the fully qualified or the relative file name, but the security check gets the fully qualified name.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Attributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the FileAttributes of the current FileSystemInfo.
member.value: FileAttributes of the current FileSystemInfo.
member.exception: The specified file does not exist.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The caller attempts to set an invalid file attribute.
Refresh cannot initialize the data.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
The value of this property is a combination of the archive, compressed, directory, hidden, offline, read-only, system, and temporary file attribute flags.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.CreationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation time of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.value: The creation date and time of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.exception: Refresh cannot initialize the data.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows NT or later.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.
This property value is a if the file system containing the FileSystemInfo object does not support this information.
Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition Platform Note: These operating systems do not support this property, and DirectoryInfo implementations of this property are not supported.
Windows Mobile for Pocket PC, Windows Mobile for Smartphone, Windows CE Platform Note: This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.CreateTimeUtc
member.summary: Gets the creation time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.value: The creation date and time in UTC format of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.exception: Refresh cannot initialize the data.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows NT or later.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.
This property value is a if the file system containing the FileSystemInfo object does not support this information.
Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition Platform Note: These operating systems do not support this property, and DirectoryInfo implementations of this property are not supported.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Exists
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the directory exists.
member.value: if the directory exists; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Extension
member.summary: Gets the string representing the extension part of the file.
member.value: A string containing the FileSystemInfo extension.
member.remarks: The Extension property returns the FileSystemInfo extension, including the period (.). For example, for a file C:\NewFile.txt, this property returns ".txt".

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.DirectoryOwner
member.summary: Gets the Windows owner associated with the directory.
member.value: A string representing the owner of the directory or if the owner cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.FullName
member.summary: Gets the full path of the directory or file.
member.value: A string containing the full path.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
member.remarks: For example, for a file C:\NewFile.txt, this property returns "C:\NewFile.txt".

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this DirectoryInfo instance.
member.value: The directory name.

remarsk.para: This Name property returns only the name of the directory, such as "Bin". To get the full path, such as "c:\public\Bin", use the FullName property.

The Name property of a DirectoryInfo requires no permission (beyond the read permission to the directory necessary to construct the Exists) but can give out the directory name. If it is necessary to hand out a DirectoryInfo to a protected directory with a cryptographically secure name, create a dummy directory for the untrusted code’s use.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent directory of a specified subdirectory.
member.value: The parent directory, or a if the path is null or if the file path denotes a root (such as "\", "C:", or * "\\server\share").
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Root
member.summary: Gets the root portion of a path.
member.value: A DirectoryInfo object representing the root of a path.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

member.summary: Creates a directory.

member.summary: Creates a directory using a DirectorySecurity object.

remarks.para: Use this method overload to create a directory with access control, so there is no chance the directory can be accessed before security is applied.
If the directory already exists, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.CreateSubdirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a subdirectory or subdirectories on the specified path. The specified path can be relative to this instance of the DirectoryInfo class.
member.param: The specified path. This cannot be a different disk volume or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) name.
member.returns: The last directory specified in path.

remarks.para: Any and all directories specified in path are created, unless some part of path is invalid. The path parameter specifies a directory path, not a file path. If the subdirectory already exists, this method does nothing.
Path names are limited to 248 characters.

member.exception: does not specify a valid file path or contains invalid DirectoryInfo characters.
is a .
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

exception.para: The subdirectory cannot be created.
-or-
A file or directory already has the name specified by path.

member.exception: The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

exception.para: The caller does not have code access permission to create the directory.
-or-
The caller does not have code access permission to read the directory described by the returned DirectoryInfo object. This can occur when the path parameter describes an existing directory.

member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

exception.para: The directory is not empty.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Delete(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes this instance of a DirectoryInfo, specifying whether to delete subdirectories and files.
member.param: to delete this directory, its subdirectories, and all files; otherwise, .
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.

exception.para: The directory is read-only.
-or-
The directory contains one or more files or subdirectories and is .
-or-
The directory is the application's current working directory.

member.remarks: If the DirectoryInfo has no files or subdirectories, this method deletes the DirectoryInfo even if recursive is false. Attempting to delete a DirectoryInfo that is not empty when recursive is false throws an IOException.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetAccessControl
member.summary: Gets a DirectorySecurity object that encapsulates the access control list (ACL) entries for the directory described by the current DirectoryInfo object.
member.returns: A DirectorySecurity object that encapsulates the access control rules for the directory.
member.exception: The directory could not be found or modified.
The current operating systme is not Microsoft Windows 2000 or later.
An I/O error occurred while opening the directory.
The file could not be found.

exception.para: The current process does not have access to open the directory.
-or-
This operation is not supported on the current platform.
-or-
The caller does not have the required permission.

remarks.para: Calling this method overload is equivalent to calling the GetAccessControl method overload and specifying the access control sections AccessControlSections.Access | AccessControlSections.Owner | AccessControlSections.Group (AccessControlSections.AccessOrAccessControlSections.OwnerOrAccessControlSections.Group in Visual Basic).
Use the GetAccessControl method to retrieve the access control list (ACL) entries for the current file.

An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file or directory. For more information, see ACL Technology Overview and How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetAccessControl(System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlSections)
member.summary: Gets a DirectorySecurity object that encapsulates the specified type of access control list (ACL) entries for the directory described by the current DirectoryInfo object.
member.param: One of the values that specifies which group of access control entries to retrieve.
member.returns: A DirectorySecurity object that encapsulates the access control rules for the file described by the path parameter.
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while opening the file.
The current operating systme is not Microsoft Windows 2000 or later.
The current system account does not have administrative privileges.
The file could not be found.

exception.para: This operation is not supported on teh current platform.
-or-
The caller does not have the required permission.

remarks.para: Use the GetAccessControl method to retrieve the access control list (ACL) entries for the current file.
An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetDirectories
member.summary: Returns the subdirectories of the current directory.
member.returns: An array of DirectoryInfo objects.
member.remarks: If there are no subdirectories, this method returns an empty array. This method is not recursive.
member.exception: The path encapsulated in the DirectoryInfo object is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetDirectories(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of directories in the current DirectoryInfo matching the given search criteria.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
member.returns: An array of type DirectoryInfo matching searchPattern.

remarks.para: Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s".
The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy.
If there are no subdirectories, or no subdirectories match the searchPattern parameter, this method returns an empty array.

member.exception: is a .
The path encapsulated in the DirectoryInfo object is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.summary: Returns an array of directories in the current DirectoryInfo matching the given search criteria and using a value to determine whether to search subdirectories.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
One of the values of the SearchOption enumeration that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories.
member.returns: An array of type DirectoryInfo matching .

remarks.para: Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s".
The string ".." can only be used in if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy.
If there are no subdirectories, or no subdirectories match the searchPattern parameter, this method returns an empty array.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetFiles
member.summary: Returns a file list from the current directory.
member.returns: An array of type FileInfo.

remarks.para: If there are no files in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array.
The order of the returned file names is not guaranteed; use the Sort method if a specific sort order is required.

member.exception: The path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a file list from the current directory matching the given searchPattern.
member.param: The search string, such as "*.txt".
member.returns: An array of type FileInfo.

remarks.para: The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in the searchPattern parameter.
The order of the returned file names is not guaranteed; use the Sort method if a specific sort order is required.

Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*.txt" searches for all file names having an extension of "txt". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all file names beginning with the letter "s". If there are no files, or no files that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array.

When using the asterisk wildcard character in a searchPattern (for example, "*.txt"), the matching behavior varies depending on the length of the specified file extension. A searchPattern with a file extension of exactly three characters returns files with an extension of three or more characters, where the first three characters match the file extension specified in the searchPattern. A searchPattern with a file extension of one, two, or more than three characters returns only files with extensions of exactly that length that match the file extension specified in the searchPattern. When using the question mark wildcard character, this method returns only files that match the specified file extension. For example, given two files in a directory, "file1.txt" and "file1.txtother", a search pattern of "file?.txt" returns only the first file, while a search pattern of "file*.txt" returns both files.
The following list shows the behavior of different lengths for the searchPattern parameter:

list.item: "*.abc" returns files having an extension of.abc,.abcd,.abcde,.abcdef, and so on.
"*.abcd" returns only files having an extension of.abcd.
"*.abcde" returns only files having an extension of.abcde.
"*.abcdef" returns only files having an extension of.abcdef.

remarks.para: Because this method checks against file names with both the 8.3 file name format and the long file name format, a search pattern similar to "*1*.txt" may return unexpected file names. For example, using a search pattern of "*1*.txt" will return "longfilename.txt" because the equivalent 8.3 file name format would be "longf~1.txt".

member.exception: is a .
The path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetFiles(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns a file list from the current directory matching the given searchPattern and using a value to determine whether to search subdirectories.
member.param: The search string, such as "*.txt".
member.returns: An array of type FileInfo.
member.param: One of the values of the SearchOption enumeration that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or should include all subdirectories.

remarks.para: The following wildcard specifiers are permitted in the searchPattern parameter.
The order of the returned file names is not guaranteed; use the Sort method if a specific sort order is required.

Wildcards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*.txt" searches for all file names having an extension of "txt". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all file names beginning with the letter "s". If there are no files, or no files that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array.

When using the asterisk wildcard character in a searchPattern (for example, "*.txt"), the matching behavior varies depending on the length of the specified file extension. A searchPattern with a file extension of exactly three characters returns files with an extension of three or more characters, where the first three characters match the file extension specified in the searchPattern. A searchPattern with a file extension of one, two, or more than three characters returns only files with extensions of exactly that length that match the file extension specified in the searchPattern. When using the question mark wildcard character, this method returns only files that match the specified file extension. For example, given two files in a directory, "file1.txt" and "file1.txtother", a search pattern of "file?.txt" returns only the first file, while a search pattern of "file*.txt" returns both files.
The following list shows the behavior of different lengths for the searchPattern parameter:

list.item: "*.abc" returns files having an extension of.abc,.abcd,.abcde,.abcdef, and so on.
"*.abcd" returns only files having an extension of.abcd.
"*.abcde" returns only files having an extension of.abcde.
"*.abcdef" returns only files having an extension of.abcdef.

remarks.para: Because this method checks against file names with both the 8.3 file name format and the long file name format, a search pattern similar to "*1*.txt" may return unexpected file names. For example, using a search pattern of "*1*.txt" will return "longfilename.txt" because the equivalent 8.3 file name format would be "longf~1.txt".

member.exception: is a .
The path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetFileSystemInfos
member.summary: Returns an array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo entries representing all the files and subdirectories in a directory.
member.returns: An array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo entries.

remarks.para: If there are no files or directories in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array. This method is not recursive.

For subdirectories, the FileSystemInfo objects returned by this method can be cast to the derived class DirectoryInfo. Use the FileAttributes value returned by the FileSystemInfo.Attributes property to determine whether the FileSystemInfo represents a file or a directory.

member.exception: The path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.GetFileSystemInfos(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo objects representing the files and subdirectories matching the specified search criteria.
member.param: The search string, such as "System*", used to search for all directories beginning with the word "System".
member.returns: An array of strongly typed FileSystemInfo objects matching the search criteria.

remarks.para: This method is not recursive.

For subdirectories, the FileSystemInfo objects returned by this method can be cast to the derived class DirectoryInfo. Use the FileAttributes value returned by the FileSystemInfo.Attributes property to determine whether the FileSystemInfo represents a file or a directory.

Wild cards are permitted. For example, the searchPattern string "*t" searches for all directory names in path ending with the letter "t". The searchPattern string "s*" searches for all directory names in path beginning with the letter "s".

The string ".." can only be used in searchPattern if it is specified as a part of a valid directory name, such as in the directory name "a..b". It cannot be used to move up the directory hierarchy. If there are no files or directories, or no files or directories that match the searchPattern string in the DirectoryInfo, this method returns an empty array.

member.exception: The path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.MoveTo(System.String)
member.summary: Moves a DirectoryInfo instance and its contents to a new path.
member.param: The name and path to which to move this directory. The destination cannot be another disk volume or a directory with the identical name. It can be an existing directory to which you want to add this directory as a subdirectory.

remarks.para: This method throws an IOException if, for example, you try to move c:\mydir to c:\public, and c:\public already exists. You must specify "c:\\public\\mydir" as the parameter, or specify a new directory name such as "c:\\newdir".
This method permits moving a directory to a read-only directory. The read/write attribute of neither directory is affected.

exception.para: is a .
-or-
The directory being moved and the destination directory have the same name.

member.exception: is an empty string ("").

exception.para: An attempt was made to move a directory to a different volume.
-or-
already exists.
-or-
You are not authorized to access this path.

member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
The destination directory cannot be found.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.
member.exception: A device such as a disk drive is not ready.

remarks.para: FileSystemInfo.Refresh takes a snapshot of the file from the current file system. Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information. This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98.
Calls must be made to Refresh before attempting to get the attribute information, or the information will be outdated.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.SetAccessControl(System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity)
member.summary: Applies access control list (ACL) entries described by a DirectorySecurity object to the directory described by the current DirectoryInfo object.
member.param: A DirectorySecurity object that describes an ACL entry to apply to the directory described by the path parameter.
member.exception: The parameter is .
The file could not be found or modified.
The current process does not have access to open the file.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows 2000 or later.

remarks.para: The SetAccessControl method applies access control list (ACL) entries to the current file that represents the noninherited ACL list.
Use the SetAccessControl method whenever you need to add or remove ACL entries from a file.

The ACL specified for the directorySecurity parameter replaces the existing ACL for the file. To add permissions for a new user, use the GetAccessControl method to obtain the existing ACL, modify it, and then use SetAccessControl to apply it back to the file.
An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file.

The SetAccessControl method persists only DirectorySecurity objects that have been modified after object creation. If a DirectorySecurity object has not been modified, it will not be persisted to a file. Therefore, it is not possible to retrieve a DirectorySecurity object from one file and reapply the same object to another file.
To copy ACL information from one file to another:

list.item: Use the GetAccessControl method to retrieve the DirectorySecurity object from the source file.
Create a new DirectorySecurity object for the destination file.
Use the GetSecurityDescriptorBinaryForm or GetSecurityDescriptorSddlForm method of the source FileSecurity object to retrieve the ACL information.
Use the SetSecurityDescriptorBinaryForm or SetSecurityDescriptorSddlForm method to copy the information retrieved in step 3 to the destination DirectorySecurity object.
Set the destination DirectorySecurity object to the destination file using the SetAccessControl method.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedDirectoryInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns the path as a string.
member.returns: A string representing the path.
member.remarks: The string returned by the ToString method represents path that was passed to the constructor. When you create a FileInfo object using the constructors, the ToString method returns the fully qualified path. However, there are cases where the string returned by the ToString method does not represent the fully qualified path. For example, when you create a FileInfo object using the GetFiles method, the ToString method does not represent the fully qualified path.

member.name: T:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo
member.summary: Provides an encapsulated implementation of the standard .NET , and the SHGetFileInfo API method.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, which acts as a wrapper for a file path.
member.param: The fully qualified name of the new file, or the relative file name.
member.exception: is a .
The caller does not have the required permission.
The file name is empty, contains only white spaces, or contains invalid characters.
Access to is denied.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
contains a colon (:) in the middle of the string.
member.remarks: You can specify either the fully qualified or the relative file name, but the security check gets the fully qualified name.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.Attributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the FileAttributes of the current FileSystemInfo.
member.value: FileAttributes of the current FileSystemInfo.
member.exception: The specified file does not exist.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The caller attempts to set an invalid file attribute.
Refresh cannot initialize the data.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
The value of this property is a combination of the archive, compressed, directory, hidden, offline, read-only, system, and temporary file attribute flags.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.Comments
member.summary: Gets the comments associated with the file.
member.value: The comments associated with the file or a if the file did not contain version information.
member.remarks: This property contains additional information that can be displayed for diagnostic purposes.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.CompanyName
member.summary: Gets the name of the company that produced the file.
member.value: The name of the company that produced the file or a if the file did not contain version information.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.CreationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation time of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.value: The creation date and time of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.exception: Refresh cannot initialize the data.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows NT or later.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.
This property value is a if the file system containing the FileSystemInfo object does not support this information.
Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition Platform Note: These operating systems do not support this property, and DirectoryInfo implementations of this property are not supported.
Windows Mobile for Pocket PC, Windows Mobile for Smartphone, Windows CE Platform Note: This property is read-only.

member.summary: Gets the creation time, in coordinated universal time (UTC), of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.value: The creation date and time in UTC format of the current FileSystemInfo object.
member.exception: Refresh cannot initialize the data.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows NT or later.

remarks.para: When first called, FileSystemInfo calls Refresh and returns the cached information on APIs to get attributes and so on. On subsequent calls, you must call Refresh to get the latest copy of the information.
If the file described in the FileSystemInfo object does not exist, this property will return 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), adjusted to local time.

NTFS-formatted drives may cache file meta-info, such as file creation time, for a short period of time. This process is known as file tunneling. As a result, it may be necessary to explicitly set the creation time of a file if you are overwriting or replacing an existing file.
This property value is a if the file system containing the FileSystemInfo object does not support this information.
Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 98 Second Edition Platform Note: These operating systems do not support this property, and DirectoryInfo implementations of this property are not supported.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.Extension
member.summary: Gets the string representing the extension part of the file.
member.value: A string containing the FileSystemInfo extension.
member.remarks: The Extension property returns the FileSystemInfo extension, including the period (.). For example, for a file C:\NewFile.txt, this property returns ".txt".

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.FileBuildPart
member.summary: Gets the build number of the file.
member.value: A value representing the build number of the file or a if the file did not contain version information.

remarks.para: Typically, a version number is displayed as "major number.minor number.build number.private part number". A file version number is a 64-bit number that holds the version number for a file as follows:

list.item: The first 16 bits are the FileMajorPart number.
The next 16 bits are the FileMinorPart number.
The third set of 16 bits are the FileBuildPart number.
The last 16 bits are the FilePrivatePart number.

remarks.para: This property gets the third set of 16 bits.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.FileDescription
member.summary: Gets the description of the file.
member.value: The description of the file or a if the file did not contain version information.

member.value: A value representing the major part of the version number or a if the file did not contain version information.

list.item: The first 16 bits are the FileMajorPart number.
The next 16 bits are the FileMinorPart number.
The third set of 16 bits are the FileBuildPart number.

remarks.para: This property gets the first set of 16 bits.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.InternalName
member.summary: Gets the internal name of the file, if one exists.
member.value: The internal name of the file. If none exists, this property will contain the original name of the file without the extension.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsDebug
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file contains debugging information or is compiled with debugging features enabled.
member.value: if the file contains debugging information or is compiled with debugging features enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The FileVersionInfo properties are based on version resource information built into the file. Version resources are often built into binary files such as .exe or .dll files; text files do not have version resource information.

Version resources are typically specified in a Win32 resource file, or in assembly attributes. The IsDebug property reflects the VS_FF_DEBUG flag value in the file's VS_FIXEDFILEINFO block, which is built from the VERSIONINFO resource in a Win32 resource file. For more information about specifying version resources in a Win32 resource file, see the Platform SDK About Resource Files topic and VERSIONINFO Resource topic topics.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsPatched
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file has been modified and is not identical to the original shipping file of the same version number.
member.value: if the file is patched; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsPreRelease
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file is a development version, rather than a commercially released product.
member.value: if the file is prerelease; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsPrivateBuild
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file was built using standard release procedures.
member.remarks: If this value is true, PrivateBuild will describe how this version of the file differs from the standard version.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the file is read only.
member.value: if the current file is read only; otherwise .
member.exception: The file described by the current object could not be found.
An I/O error occurred while opening the file.

exception.para: The file described by the current object could not be found.
-or-
This operation is not supported on the current paltform.
-or-
THe called does not have the required permissions.

remarsk.para: Use the property to quickly determine or change whether the current file is read only.
When first called, calls and caches information on the file. On subsequent calls, you must call to get the latest copy of the information.

member.name: P:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.IsSpecialBuild
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the file is a special build.
member.value: if the file is a special build; otherwise, .
member.remarks: A file that is a special build was built using standard release procedures, but the file differs from a standard file of the same version number. If this value is true, the SpecialBuild property must specify how this file differs from the standard version.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.AppendText
member.summary: Creates a that appends text to the file represented by this instance of the .

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.CopyTo(System.String)
member.summary: Copies an existing file to a new file, disallowing the overwriting of an existing file.
member.param: The name of the new file to copy to.
member.returns: A new file with a fully qualified path.
member.exception: is empty, contains only white space, or contains invalid characters.
An error occurs, or the destination file already exists.
The caller does not have the required permission.
is a .
A directory path is passed in, or the file is being moved to a differnt drive.
The directory specified in does not exist.

The specified path, file name, or both exceeded the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.

remarks.para: Use the method to allow overwriting of an existing file.

Whenever possible, avoid using short file names (such as XXXXXX~1.XXX) with this method. If two files have equivalent short file names then this method may fail and raise an exception and/or result in undesirable behavior.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.CopyTo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies an existing file to a new file, allowing the overwriting of an existing file.
member.param: The name of the new file to copy to.
to allow an existing file to be overwritten; otherwise .
member.returns: A new file, or an overwrite of an existing file if is . If the file exists and is , an is thrown.
member.exception: is empty, contains only white space, or contains invalid characters.
An error occurs, or the destination file already exists and is .
The caller does not have the required permission.
is a .
A directory path is passed in, or the file is being moved to a differnt drive.
The directory specified in does not exist.

The specified path, file name, or both exceeded the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
contains a colon (:) in the middle of the string.

remarks.para: Use this method to allow or prevent overwriting of an existing file. Use the method to prevent overwriting of an existing file by default.

Whenever possible, avoid using short file names (such as XXXXXX~1.XXX) with this method. If two files have equivalent short file names then this method may fail and raise an exception and/or result in undesirable behavior.

member.summary: Creates a file.
member.returns: A new file.

remarks.para: By default, full read/write access to new files is granted to all users.
This method is a wrapper for the functionality provided by .

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.Delete
member.summary: Permanently deletes a file.
member.exception: The target file is open or memory-mapped on a computer running Microsoft Windows NT.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The path is a directory.

remarks.para: If the file does not exist, this method does nothing.
Windows NT 4.0 Platform Note: does not delete a file that is open for normal I/O or a file that is memory-mapped.

member.param: The path to move the file to, which can specify a different file name.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs, such as the destination file already exists or the destination device is not ready.
is a .
is empty, contains only white space, or contains invalid characters.
The caller does not have the required permission.
is read-only or is a directory.
The file is not found.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.

The specified path, file name, or both exceeded the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
contains a colon (:) in the middle of the string.

remarks.para: This method works across disk volumes. For example, the file C:\MyFile.txt can be moved to D:\public and renamed NewFile.txt.
Windows Mobile for Pocket PC, Windows Mobile for Smartphone, Windows CE Platform Note: Some device file systems do not support relative paths. Specify absolute path information.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the state of the object.
member.exception: A device such as a disk drive is not ready.

remarks.para: FileSystemInfo.Refresh takes a snapshot of the file from the current file system. Refresh cannot correct the underlying file system even if the file system returns incorrect or outdated information. This can happen on platforms such as Windows 98.
Calls must be made to Refresh before attempting to get the attribute information, or the information will be outdated.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.SetAccessControl(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity)
member.summary: Applies access control list (ACL) entries described by a FileSecurity object to the file described by the current FileInfo object.
member.param: A FileSecurity object that describes an access control list (ACL) entry to apply to the current file.
member.exception: The parameter is .
The file could not be found or modified.
The current process does not have access to open the file.
The current operating system is not Microsoft Windows 2000 or later.

remarks.para: The SetAccessControl method applies access control list (ACL) entries to the current file that represents the noninherited ACL list.
Use the SetAccessControl method whenever you need to add or remove ACL entries from a file.

The ACL specified for the fileSecurity parameter replaces the existing ACL for the file. To add permissions for a new user, use the GetAccessControl method to obtain the existing ACL, modify it, and then use SetAccessControl to apply it back to the file.
An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file.

The SetAccessControl method persists only FileSecurity objects that have been modified after object creation. If a FileSecurity object has not been modified, it will not be persisted to a file. Therefore, it is not possible to retrieve a FileSecurity object from one file and reapply the same object to another file.
To copy ACL information from one file to another:

list.item: Use the GetAccessControl method to retrieve the FileSecurity object from the source file.
Create a new FileSecurity object for the destination file.
Use the GetSecurityDescriptorBinaryForm or GetSecurityDescriptorSddlForm method of the source FileSecurity object to retrieve the ACL information.
Use the SetSecurityDescriptorBinaryForm or SetSecurityDescriptorSddlForm method to copy the information retrieved in step 3 to the destination FileSecurity object.
Set the destination FileSecurity object to the destination file using the SetAccessControl method.

member.name: M:Cadru.IO.ExtendedFileInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns the path as a string.
member.returns: A string representing the path.
member.remarks: The string returned by the ToString method represents path that was passed to the constructor. When you create a FileInfo object using the constructors, the ToString method returns the fully qualified path. However, there are cases where the string returned by the ToString method does not represent the fully qualified path. For example, when you create a FileInfo object using the GetFiles method, the ToString method does not represent the fully qualified path.

member.name: T:Cadru.IO.Interop.Constants
